intro: Phebalium squamulosum subsp. argenteum, commonly known as silverleaf hakea, is a shrub native to south-western Australia. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in dense, glandular hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in cylindrical spikes, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable plant for rock gardens and coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is often cultivated in gardens across southern Australia.
